Date: October 28, 2025

Hiring Team — Power Home Remodeling — Fort Lauderdale Territory (Sunrise) Sawgrass Tech Park, 1637 NW 136th Ave, Building G‑100, Sunrise, FL 33323

Hello Power Team,

“Hustle meets purpose” is exactly how I like to work. I’m applying for the Entry‑Level Sales Representative role in Sunrise to learn the Power way, master interactive homeowner presentations, and earn leadership by delivering results. Power’s people‑first model is proven: Fortune Top 100, and a leadership bench where about 90% start in this seat. That’s the ladder I want to climb, the right way.

I bring a communication toolkit built in high‑stakes rooms. As a certified county mediator, I maintained a 0% impasse rate across 70+ cases, with about 90 minutes to signed agreement. That playbook maps cleanly to sales: listen deeply, isolate the real objection, connect value to the homeowner’s goal, and close with clear next steps. In my Donor Family Advocate role, I guided more than 40 families through sensitive decisions with 100% policy accuracy. These experiences prove that I stay precise under pressure and keep trust at the center of every conversation.

Why Power and why Sunrise: you combine energy‑efficient exterior solutions (windows, roofing, siding, doors, insulation, solar) with a people‑first culture that turns beginners into confident presenters. Broward homeowners care most about comfort, hurricane peace of mind, and quiet. My demos tie those priorities directly to tighter windows and doors, impact‑minded roofing and siding, and insulation. I anchor proposals to a simple, homeowner‑friendly value story—comfort, quiet, costs—and offer two clear choices and a next step. I’m comfortable with evenings, weekends, and field‑based work, and I treat rejection as data: adjust the script, tighten discovery, and move to the next door.

How I’ll add value in my first 90 days

  • Deliver interactive presentations: 12+ homeowner presentations per week, daily role‑plays, and one filmed pitch each week.
  • Improve the right numbers: track show rate, proposal rate, close percentage, and referrals. Increase proposal‑to‑close by five to ten points by Day 60 through sharper discovery and a two‑question objection isolation.
  • Be coachable and give back: join weekly coaching camps, publish a one‑page summary (“what worked and why”) each Friday, and by Day 60, mentor a new hire on demo setup while running a ten‑minute micro‑lesson for the team.
  • Operate like a professional: maintain clean CRM notes and a daily activity scoreboard (pitches, shows, proposals, closes, referrals) so my manager can help me iterate quickly.
  • Sell the mission: tie eco‑friendly upgrades to tangible homeowner outcomes—comfort and costs today, efficiency and resilience long‑term.

I’m ready to represent Power’s brand with energy and integrity in Sunrise, learn fast, and grow the right way by earning it. I’ve included a one‑page 30/60/90, a homeowner talk‑track, and a training participation plan aligned to your model. I can also deliver a five‑minute live demo of my talk‑track during the interview, if helpful.

Best regards,
Matthew James Carbonell
